data.title: 35 Celebs Who Actually Married Their Fans
data.meta_description: If you've ever fantasized about sharing your life with your beloved celebrity, this list will give you hope.
data.text:
In this timeless tale, a boy meets a girl, and love blooms—except this girl discovers the boy is a global superstar. Despite the glam, these couples find joy in opulent mansions. Inspired by real-life stories like Matt Damon meeting his bartender wife, or Julia Roberts marrying her admirer, these narratives suggest that a celebrity falling for an ordinary person is not just a dream.

Ready for your shot at a celebrity romance?

Matthew Lewis

Instagram

In May 2018, Matthew Lewis, renowned for portraying Neville Longbottom in the Harry Potter film series, tied the knot with lifestyle blogger Angela Jones. Their paths crossed at the Wizarding World of Harry Potter in Orlando, Florida, where Jones, an event planner and avid Harry Potter enthusiast, was working.

Christian Bale

Christian Bale encountered his wife while she served as an assistant to Winona Ryder.

Ruben Studdard

Ruben Studdard initially crossed paths with his wife, Surata Zuri McCants, in 2006 at a Wal-Mart while he was signing CDs.

Elvis Presley

At the tender age of 14, Priscilla Presley first encountered Elvis, her teenage idol. Like many girls of her generation, Priscilla was captivated by the rock star.

Taylor Lautner

Before Twilight star Taylor Lautner found his match, he first got acquainted with her family. Lautner’s sister, Makena Moore, introduced him to Taylor Dome after meeting her at a Nashville church. Moore later celebrated their engagement on Instagram, writing, “Think I picked out a good one for my brother.”

Dome, a registered nurse who worked during the peak of the COVID-19 pandemic, launched The Lemons Foundation in June, a nonprofit focused on mental health support and advocacy. She also created the blog Lemons by Tay and co-hosts a podcast with Lautner called “The Squeeze,” both addressing mental health and wellness.

Tom Cruise

Katie Holmes had been a fan of Tom Cruise long before their marriage. According to her ex-high school classmate, Holmes would even offer prayers for Tom Cruise’s well-being during their religion class.

Julia Roberts

Cinematographer Danny Moder was such an admirer of Julia Roberts’ work on the set of The Mexican that he ended up marrying her in 2002.

Mariah Carey

Mariah Carey tied the knot with Nick Cannon in 2008, and even after their six-year marriage came to an end, Nick Cannon continues to publicly express his admiration for Mariah.

Matt Damon

Matt Damon encountered his future wife, Luciana Bozan Barroso, while filming Stuck on You in Miami. One night, he decided to visit a bar where she was bartending, and the rest is history.

Conan O’Brien

Conan O’Brien crossed paths with his wife, Liza Powel, when she joined his late-night talk show as a producer.

Reese Witherspoon

Talent agent Jim Toth, recognizing a star, met his future wife, Reese Witherspoon, at a bar where his friend was clumsily hitting on her. The two eventually married in 2011.

Patrick Dempsey

Patrick Dempsey encountered his future fan-wife, Jillian, when he visited her salon for a haircut.

Adam Sandler

Adam Sandler’s wife, Jackie Titone, was a fan of his work long before she had a bit part in Big Daddy. The couple tied the knot a few years later.

Kelsey Grammer

Kelsey Grammer and Kayte Walsh exchanged vows in 2011. Interestingly, Kayte’s father was a devoted fan of Cheers and Frasier during her upbringing.

John Travolta

Kelly Preston, enamored with John Travolta in Grease, felt a deep connection and believed they were meant to be together.

Steve Harvey

Steve Harvey encountered his future wife, Marjorie, when she attended one of his stand-up performances in Memphis.

Chris Martin

Gwyneth Paltrow was a fan of her future husband’s band, Coldplay, before they even met. Their introduction took place backstage at one of his performances.

Ringo Starr

Ringo Starr’s ex-wife, Maureen, was a devoted fan of The Beatles and had a crush on the drummer before they eventually tied the knot.

Danny Bonaduce

Amy Railsback, reportedly a fan of Breaking Bonaduce, crossed paths with Danny Bonaduce at a coffee shop in 2007. The couple later married in 2010.

Anne Hathaway

Anne Hathaway found a fan in producer Adam Shulman, who went on to become her husband in 2012. Shulman, a long-time admirer of the actor, presumably expressed his admiration after they met through friends a few years before getting married.

Corey Feldman

Corey Feldman encountered Susie Feldman (née Sprague) while she was celebrating her 19th birthday with friends. The actor and Playboy playmate tied the knot on Corey’s reality show, The Two Coreys, in 2002. Despite Corey breaking his cardinal relationship rules by marrying a fan he met in a nightclub, the couple separated in 2009 and officially divorced in 2014.

Billie Joe Armstrong

Backstage at a 1990 show in Minnesota, Green Day’s frontman Billie Joe Armstrong first encountered his future wife, Adrienne Armstrong (née Nesser). Having seen the band the night before at a house party, Adrienne was impressed and decided to attend their show the next day, purchasing an album. Although they didn’t start dating immediately, the backstage interaction left Billie Joe with a crush. After an initial attempt at a long-distance relationship and some time apart, the two eventually reconnected and got married in 1994.

Wiz Khalifa

Rapper Wiz Khalifa and model Amber Rose had thriving careers when they began dating, and their public displays of affection indicated a longstanding interest in each other. Notably, Rose posted an Instagram photo of Khalifa with the caption “#MCM this was the first picture I ever saw of this handsome guy. Now he’s all mine!” Although their marriage was brief, they seem to continue supporting each other even after their 2016 divorce.

Justin Bieber

A whole generation of fans dreamt about marrying Justin Bieber, and one of them turned out to be right. Hailey Bieber (née Baldwin) was a well-documented Belieber before she and the singer embarked on a whirlwind romance that culminated in their 2018 wedding. As noted by Elite Daily, a younger Hailey tweeted at and about the star, waited in a crowd of fans to catch a glimpse of him outside her hotel, and eventually met him, thanks in part to her famous dad, Stephen Baldwin.

Josh Duhamel

Josh Duhamel openly expressed his admiration for Fergie of the Black Eyed Peas before the group appeared on his TV show, Las Vegas. Aware of his crush, Fergie approached the actor on set, sparking the relationship that eventually led to their marriage in 2009. Despite having a child together, navigating a cheating scandal, and nearly a decade as a couple, they finalized their divorce in 2019.

Kim Kardashian

Upon seeing a 2006 picture of Kim Kardashian with her friend Paris Hilton, Kanye West was captivated and inquired if his friend had ever heard of this “Kim Kar-dijon” woman. In 2012, with both of their careers soaring even higher, they began dating (while Kim was still with Kris Humphries) and eventually tied the knot in 2014. Today, the couple has four children.

Kevin Bacon

Kyra Sedgwick and Kevin Bacon, one of Hollywood’s enduring couples, first crossed paths when she was just 12. After seeing him perform in a matinee play, Sedgwick approached Bacon in a deli. Although they didn’t start dating until they reunited on the set of 1988’s Lemon Sky, they got married that same year and have been together ever since. Bacon shared this delightful story on The Late Late Show With Craig Ferguson in 2014.

Jerry Seinfeld

Jerry Seinfeld and his wife of 21 years, Jessica Seinfeld (née Sklar), initially met at the gym in 1998 when she was just two months into her first marriage. Despite her ongoing relationship, which was already facing challenges, Jessica, being a fan of Jerry’s show, began dating him in secret. The situation came to light when Jessica’s husband discovered the affair through paparazzi shots, leading to their divorce. Jerry and Jessica subsequently tied the knot at the end of ’99.

Carmelo Anthony

NBA player Carmelo Anthony, already a star, became another fan when he met TV presenter La La Vasquez. Introduced by mutual friend DJ Clue, who informed the TRL host about Anthony’s interest, the couple wed in 2010. Their domestic life has been documented by VH1 reality shows.

Ashton Kutcher and Mila Kunis

Mila Kunis and Ashton Kutcher, now happily married since 2015 with two beautiful children, initially crossed paths as co-stars on That ’70s Show. While their relationship during the series was initially casual, Kunis confesses to having the “greatest infatuation” with Kutcher at the time. In fact, she had her first kiss with him and admitted being nervous and uncomfortable, expressing her big crush on him. Despite the casual beginning, their on-screen romance eventually blossomed into a real-life love story.

Alexis Bledel

After meeting on the set of the show “Mad Men,” the actress from Gilmore Girls left a lasting impression on Vincent Kartheiser. While working on Mad Men, both Vincent and Alexis were described as “totally professional,” but co-star Jon Hamm suspected that there was more happening beneath the surface. Hamm confessed, “I did know he liked her from a very early point.”

Machine Gun Kelly

Machine Gun Kelly, also known as Colson Baker, and Megan Fox met on the set of “Midnight in the Switchgrass” and quickly connected. In an interview with GQ, Machine Gun Kelly revealed that he is dating his high school crush, Megan Fox. He admitted to having a poster of Fox on his wall in his younger days. The couple got engaged in January 2022 after dating for a year and a half.

Emily Blunt

John Krasinski openly admits to having admired his now-wife, Emily Blunt, for a long time. He revealed during an interview that his favorite film was “The Devil Wears Prada,” a romantic comedy starring Blunt. In a humorous tone, Krasinski joked, “I’m lucky enough that she stayed with me and didn’t realize that she had really married her stalker!”

Even before meeting her, he considered her his first choice. Krasinski fell in love with Blunt the moment he met her in a café in Los Angeles, nervously confessing, “I was like, ‘Oh god, I think I’m going to fall in love with her.’ As I shook her hand, I went, ‘I like you.'”

Prince Harry and Kate Middleton

Prince William and Kate Middleton’s love story has a charming beginning and a happy ending. They started dating while students at the University of St. Andrews in Scotland, sharing off-campus accommodation. Their relationship became public in 2004, and they eventually married in 2010.

According to royal expert Katie Nicholl, a former roommate and companion of Kate from her boarding school revealed that Kate had a significant crush on her future husband. The friend shared that Kate would playfully joke, “There’s no one quite like William.” This friend even confessed that the Duchess of Cambridge had a poster of Prince William hanging on her wall. Although Kate later denied this, her husband enjoys joking about it.

Chris Pratt

Nearly a year before they started dating, the author of “The Gift of Forgiveness” considered her future spouse her favorite. The couple began their romantic journey in the summer of 2018 and got married a year later. They welcomed their first child, a baby girl, last year.

During an interview, Katherine Schwarzenegger was asked to choose her favorite among famous Chrises – Chris Hemsworth, Chris Evans, or Chris Pratt. She initially picked Chris Evans but quickly retracted, saying, “Actually, Chris Pratt. Chris Pratt has been looking good lately, so you never know!”

When shown this interview clip years later, Chris Pratt was surprised and responded, “That’s so sweet. I literally have never seen that before, so thank you for showing me that,” appearing visibly moved by the clip.

Jamie Lee Curtis and Christopher Guest

Jamie Lee Curtis and Christopher Guest have been married since 1984, and Curtis has shared that their connection was immediate.

She recounted an interesting moment, saying, “Debra Hill and I were flipping through a Rolling Stone magazine when I turned to a photograph of 3 men. I looked at the man on the right, wearing a plaid shirt and a waggish smirk. I’d never seen him before, but I pointed at him. ’I’m going to marry that man,’ I said to my friend.” That man turned out to be Christopher Guest.

Please SHARE this with your friends and family.

Article Sources:

To learn more read our Editorial Standards.

Eduardo Gaskell
